title: earth to people’s debut furniture collection utilizes tree sap and salvaged wood

text: EARTH TO PEOPLE INTRODUCes SALVAGE & SAPEarth To People introduces Salvage & Sap, a debut furniture collection rooted in ancient stewardship principles. This collection revives the 45,000-year-old practice of using natural tree sap as a wood binder, eliminating the need for synthetic glues. The collection, made from cedar and aluminum, includes a dining chair, armchair, wall sconce, floor lamp, and table lamp. Hand-carved wooden dowels crafted from offcuts replace modern fasteners, windfallen trees are harvested instead of logging, and salvaged metal is repurposed rather than sourcing new materials.all images by James HanSALVAGE & SAP Revives Ancient CraftsmanshipNatural construction techniques honor the resourcefulness of past cultures, emphasizing the value of repurposing and reworking resources thoughtfully. The Salvage & Sap series is a conscious effort to learn from historical practices to shape a more sustainable future. The design duo created their first sap chair in 2024, laying the foundation for this thoughtful range. html:
EARTH TO PEOPLE INTRODUCes SALVAGE & SAP

Earth To People introduces Salvage & Sap, a debut furniture collection rooted in ancient stewardship principles. This collection revives the 45,000-year-old practice of using natural tree sap as a wood binder, eliminating the need for synthetic glues. The collection, made from cedar and aluminum, includes a dining chair, armchair, wall sconce, floor lamp, and table lamp. Hand-carved wooden dowels crafted from offcuts replace modern fasteners, windfallen trees are harvested instead of logging, and salvaged metal is repurposed rather than sourcing new materials.


all images by James Han

SALVAGE & SAP Revives Ancient Craftsmanship

Natural construction techniques honor the resourcefulness of past cultures, emphasizing the value of repurposing and reworking resources thoughtfully. The Salvage & Sap series is a conscious effort to learn from historical practices to shape a more sustainable future. The design duo created their first sap chair in 2024, laying the foundation for this thoughtful range. With a presence in New York, Texas, and British Columbia, Earth To People extends its commitment to mindful design through architecture, interiors, furniture, and lighting.


introducing Salvage & Sap by Earth To People: a furniture collection rooted in ancient stewardship principles


the Salvage & Sap series revives the 45,000-year-old practice of using natural tree sap as a wood binder


hand-carved wooden dowels, crafted from offcuts, replace modern fasteners in this sustainable collection


windfallen trees are harvested, avoiding the need for logging, to create these unique designs


the pieces are glued together with tree sap, harnessing pine resin as an adhesive
